title: Writing About an Important Relationship
description: Write about someone who is important to you and how they have influenced your life.

prompt.topic: An Important Person in My Life
prompt.description: Write about a person who is important to you (a friend, family member, teacher, or mentor). Describe your relationship with them, explain why they are important to you, and share how they have influenced or helped you.
requirements: Describe who the person is and how you know them
Give specific examples of how they have helped or influenced you
Describe what qualities make them special
Express your feelings about the relationship

exampleSentences.sentence: One of the most important people in my life is my best friend, Sarah.
exampleSentences.translation: 제 인생에서 가장 중요한 사람 중 하나는 제 친한 친구 사라예요.

exampleSentences.sentence: We have known each other since we were in high school.
exampleSentences.useCase: To describe how long you've known them

exampleSentences.sentence: She has always been there for me during difficult times.
exampleSentences.translation: 그녀는 어려운 시간에 항상 곁에 있어 줬어요.

exampleSentences.sentence: What I appreciate most about her is her honesty.
Thanks to her advice, I was able to make better decisions.
exampleSentences.translation: 그녀의 조언 덕분에 더 나은 결정을 할 수 있었어요.

exampleSentences.sentence: I feel grateful to have such a supportive person in my life.
exampleSentences.translation: 제 삶에 이렇게 든든한 사람이 있어서 감사해요.

vocabularyHelp.example: She is very supportive of my dreams.
He has influenced my career choices.
He's a reliable friend I can always count on.
She always encourages me to try new things.
He has been like a mentor to me.
I admire her many positive qualities.

usefulExpressions.expression: One of the most important people in my life is...
usefulExpressions.example: One of the most important people in my life is my grandmother.

usefulExpressions.expression: What I admire about them is...
usefulExpressions.example: What I admire about them is their patience.
They have taught me that hard work pays off.

usefulExpressions.expression: I don't know what I would do without...
usefulExpressions.example: I don't know what I would do without their support.

usefulExpressions.usage: To describe the foundation of a relationship
usefulExpressions.example: Our relationship is based on mutual trust and respect.

items: Did you clearly identify who the person is?
Did you describe your relationship with them?
Did you give specific examples of their influence?
Did you describe their positive qualities?
Did you express your feelings about the relationship?
Did you use Present Perfect for experiences?
Did you use a variety of tenses appropriately?
Did you organize your ideas logically?
Did you use correct reported speech if quoting?
Did you use varied vocabulary for relationships?
Did you use descriptive adjectives for qualities?
Did you use connecting words effectively?
Is your writing at least 130 words?
Is your writing no more than 180 words?
Does your writing have a clear introduction and conclusion?
Did you complete within the time limit?
